title: Teach me mechanics! (My embarrassing confession...)
body:
After four years of playing this game, and on the verge of gold, I think it is about time I addressed my biggest flaw when it comes to mechanics; how to auto attack with melee champions. 

I seem to auto attack cancel more then I actually auto attack, and I can't figure out for the life of me, why my auto attacks cancel. 
I figure it has something to do with the way I move and auto as a meele champion; but I have zero idea, say how to chase as a meele while auto attacking. 

Why do my AA's cancel so often?
What should I be doing?

replies.body:
Holy %%%%, no offense but if i played for 4 years and wasn't gold I would probably find a new game to play.

I've been playing for two years and I stomp plats.

Well I started from a very different background.
This is the only computer game I've every played.
Majority of my first season was figuring out how to press buttons without looking, or how to move my mouse and click seemlessly.
Even now, while I have the QWER down, I can't use summoners or the numbers without looking. 
I play the best I can with my mechanical disadvantages.
At this moment I'm one win away from gold. 
I'll get there in my own time. 
And I'll be hella proud when I do.

I changed my keys to ads, much easier
a = q
s = e
d = w

I think melee aa's have a longer windup animation than ranged aa's. You're probably just used to cancelling ranged attack animations as soon as the projectile appears. With melee champions you can still animation cancel, but you need to wait until you've connected with your enemy before move-ordering.

So if you click a move command, while the meele auto attack animation is still in progress it will cancel?
If that's the case how do you chase while auto-ing as a meele; wouldn't you be continually stopping?

Yes, and as long as you've already struck your enemy, the only part that will cancel is the follow-through, not the actual strike. Of course it takes quite a bit of practice to perform well, because you have to be consistently right clicking in a fast rhythm. Attack-swing-move, attack-swing-move, attack-swing-move. A lot of people recommend playing osu to train your orb walking skills, because similarly that involves high-intensity hyper-accurate mouse movements. 
 
Of course you're continually stopping, but usually you'll either have a large movement speed buff (for carries, like yi) or your enemy will be slowed (for brawlers like darius), allowing you to close the gap on your enemy. If you're fast enough, you can actually stay *in front* of your enemy, causing their autopathing to attempt to take them around you, thus making orbwalking even more effective. 

Remember, the whole idea behind orb walking is minimizing the amount of time you are stood still aa'ing by cutting off the second half of your attack animation. It's all about timing.

best champ to learn the basics of melee "orb walking" is udyr. you can just around someone in a circle and still auto attack efficiently with him once you get good enough. also his animation is so short he can start moving again instantly.

yi is a BAD choice for it, as he is too fast you dont learn anything, you can basically just Q a-move and it does it all for you.

The key of thumb is to think of the auto attack as three parts, the wind up, the damage point and the cooling down period.

The wind up refers to the part where the attack starts but hasn't connected yet. The reason why you're cancelling your AAs is that you are moving/cancelling during this period. i.e you are trying to cancel too early

The period when you SHOULD move is when you reach the damage point which is when the attack has connected.

You should keep moving until the cooling down period (the period where you are unable to auto attack) and attack again.

Repeat the above and you should be a pro at it soon.

That's what I've done for four year :S.
I at least want the opportunity to expand my horizons.

While I don't play a large variety of melee champs, I can say it's worth knowing exactly when in the animation the damage appears from a melee attack. For example, as Riven, if you auto and see the damage appear, you can immediately press q and you will get both an auto and a Q's worth of damage. The same thing applies for attacking then moving, a lot of it is champion specific as they all have different attack windups, but if you say particular champions, I might be able to help out more.
